page.title: 18Horton Heath Methodist Ch.
page.content: Members of the Wesleyan Methodist Chapel at Horton Heath used to meet and worship in what was a farm building - more of a barn really.The ruins are still visible in the farmhouse garden. In the mid 1800's the villagers decided they needed a new chapel.They leased an acre of land from Lord Shaftesbury about 1/4 of a mile from the original site.For one reason or another the Chapel grant was withdrawn.The villagers then built and financed the Chapel themselves.At one stage during the building a Mr.Robert Rose went to the site with a copy of the plans saying the building was incorrect.An argument started,the plans were knocked from his hands into the wall cavity were they still remain. In 1877 the Chapel was completed
